title: feat(quic): implement Flow Control (RFC 9000 §4)
body:
## RFC 9000 Section 4: Flow Control

### Overview
Implement credit-based flow control at connection and stream levels.

### Complexity: MEDIUM (~400 lines)
Window tracking and credit advertisement.

### Key Requirements
- Connection-level: MAX_DATA limits total bytes
- Stream-level: MAX_STREAM_DATA per stream
- Stream count: MAX_STREAMS limits concurrent streams
- BLOCKED frames signal flow control limits reached
- Credit-based: receiver advertises limits, sender respects

### Implementation
**Files:**
- `include/quic/SocketQUICFlow.h`
- `src/quic/SocketQUICFlow.c`

**Data Structures:**
```c
typedef struct {
    uint64_t send_window;      // Bytes we can send
    uint64_t recv_window;      // Bytes we'll accept
    uint64_t bytes_sent;       // Total bytes sent
    uint64_t bytes_received;   // Total bytes received
    uint64_t max_data_local;   // Our limit
    uint64_t max_data_peer;    // Peer's limit
} SocketQUICFlowControl_T;
```

**Functions:**
```c
int SocketQUICFlow_can_send(SocketQUICFlowControl_T *fc, size_t bytes);
void SocketQUICFlow_consume_send(SocketQUICFlowControl_T *fc, size_t bytes);
void SocketQUICFlow_update_max_data(SocketQUICFlowControl_T *fc, uint64_t max);
```

### Dependencies
- #386 (Section 2 - Streams)
- #393 (Section 19.9-19.11 - MAX frames)
- #394 (Section 19.12-19.14 - BLOCKED frames)

### Reference
- Pattern: HTTP/2 flow control in `src/http/SocketHTTP2-flow.c`
